translations.translation: for you and for your livestock to enjoy.
As convenience for you and your cattle.
all this as provision for you and your cattle.
All this was done as a means of enjoyment for you and your cattle.
In order to benefit you and your cattle.
As provision and benefit for you and your cattle.
A provision for you and for your cattle.
an enjoyment for you and your flocks.
A provision for you and for your cattle.
[all this] as a means of sustenance for you and your animals?
A provision for you and your cattle.
as a [place of] sustenance for you and your livestock.
For use and convenience to you and your cattle.
(To be) a provision and benefit for you and your cattle.
an enjoyment for you and your herds.
A source of enjoyment for you and for your animals.
As provision for you and your grazing livestock.

[79:33] as a [source of] sustenance (an object denoting reason for an implied [verbal clause], in other words, fa‘ala dhālika mut‘atan or tamtī‘an, ‘He did this to provide [a source of] sustenance’) for you and your flocks (an‘ām is the plural of na‘am, which are camels, cows and sheep).
(A provision for you) water of benefit to you (and for your cattle) water and pasture benefit your cattle.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text:
لتكون { مَتَاعاً لَّكُمْ } أي: تمتيعاً لكم عليها { وَلأَنْعَامِكُمْ } [النازعات: 33] أيضاً
 فإنها من لواحق معائشكم ومتمماتها

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
كما قال تعالى: { متاعاً لكم ولأنعامكم } أي: فجعل ذلك تمتيعاً لكم ولأنعامكم
 فهو مفعول لأجله لأنَّ فائدة البسط والتمهيد وإخراج الماء والمرعى واصلة للإنسان والأنعام
 أو: مصدر من غير لفظه
 فإنَّ قوله تعالى: { أخرج منها ماءها ومرعاها } في معنى: متّعكم بذلك
